column2: NOTE: Table reads (for US Totals):  Of all 3,441,394 public school male students reported to have been harassed or bullied on the basis of race, color or national origin, 56,234 (1.6%) were American Indian or Alaska Native, 736,069 (21.4%) were students with disabilities served under the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (IDEA), and 86,034 (2.5%) were students with disabilities served solely under Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973.
The ‘1 to 3’ reference indicates that the data have been suppressed based on the schools’ reported n-size, and that a midpoint was used to calculate the total.
Data reported in this table represent 99.9% of responding schools.

SOURCE: U.S. Department of Education, Office for Civil Rights, Civil Rights Data Collection, 2013-14, available at http://ocrdata.ed.gov.
